questions.a: No. Gen-Z IITian (IIT Pathshala) is a personal initiative by Sriram R and his team to help students. We are not officially affiliated with IIT Madras.
Sriram is a dual-degree student (VIT + IITM BS) and a content creator who simplifies the IITM BS curriculum for thousands of students via YouTube and this platform.
Most resources here are free. We also offer mentorship and specific courses under the 'IIT Pathshala' banner which might be paid.
Anyone who has passed Class 12 (or equivalent) with Mathematics and English in Class 10. There is no age limit (17-80+ years enrolled) and no stream restriction.

questions.q: Can I join if I am from Arts/Commerce?
questions.a: Yes! The program starts from scratch. Math 1 covers basics like sets and functions. However, you must put in extra effort in the first term if you haven't done Math in Class 11/12.
No. Regular Entry is through the Qualifier Exam. JEE-based entry is only for those who qualified for JEE Advanced in the current year (Direct Admission).

questions.q: How does the Qualifier Process work?
questions.a:
1. Register & Pay Fee.
2. Study 4 weeks of content (Math, Stats, English, CT).
3. Submit weekly assignments (online).
4. Write the In-Person Qualifier Exam.
5. Score >50% (General) overall and >40% in each subject.
If passed, valid for 1 year (3 terms). For current Class 12 students, valid for 2 years (6 terms).

questions.q: Can I do this with another degree?
questions.a: Yes, UGC allows dual degrees. You can pursue this online while doing a regular BTech/BSc/BA on-campus.

questions.q: Is this a real IIT Degree?
questions.a: Yes. It is a BS Degree from IIT Madras. You become an alumnus of IIT Madras upon graduation. The only difference is the mode of delivery (Online vs Campus).

questions.q: What is the new Diploma in DS Pathway?
questions.a:
From Sep 2025, you have two options for the remaining 6 credits in Diploma DS:
Option 1: Business Analytics (4 Cr) + BDM Project (2 Cr).
Option 2: Intro to Deep Learning & GenAI (4 Cr) + DL/GenAI Project (2 Cr).

CCC limits how many courses you can take.
Default: 4 courses.
Reduced: If you fail courses or get low grades, CCC drops to 3 or 2.
Calculation: Based on the previous term's T-score and failures.

I_OP (Incomplete - Option to Pass).
Given if internal score (Assignments + Quizzes) is good (>40%) but you missed/failed the End Term.
Benefit: You don't repeat assignments. You only write the End Term exam in the next term.

questions.q: What is the difference between U and W?
questions.a:
U (Unqualified): You failed the course. Must repeat everything and pay full fees.
W (Withdrawn): You dropped the course before the deadline. Counts as an attempt but doesn't affect CGPA. No refund.

questions.q: How is the Final Grade calculated?
questions.a:
Standard Formula (varies by course):
T = 0.1(Avg Assignments) + 0.3(Quiz 1) + 0.3(Quiz 2) + 0.4(End Term)
Note: Often 'Best of Q1 or Q2' logic is applied in some courses, but never rely on it. Assume both count.

1. Total Score (T) >= 40/100.
2. End Term Score >= 40% (i.e., 20/50 marks typically).
3. Attend at least one Quiz.
Yes. You can drop a course after registering. If dropped early (first few weeks), you might get a partial refund (wallet adjustment). Late drops result in 'W' grade and no refund.

questions.q: What is the SCT for OPPE?
questions.a: System Compatibility Test (SCT). It is MANDATORY. You must pass this test (usually a simple check of your camera, mic, and environment) before the actual OPPE. If you miss SCT, you will NOT be allowed to write the OPPE.

questions.q: Do Mock Tests give extra marks?
questions.a: NO. Mock tests are purely for practice. However, attending them ensures your system is ready and you know the interface.
Bonus marks are awarded ONLY if there is an error in the question paper OR for specific extra activities in some courses (like Stats 1/2).

questions.q: What happens if I miss a Quiz?
questions.a: If you miss one Quiz, the other Quiz score is usually considered with a penalty or specific formula adjustment. If you miss BOTH quizzes, you are ineligible for the End Term.

questions.q: Can I change my Exam City?
questions.a: You select preferences before every term. Once the Hall Ticket is released, changes are rare and usually require a medical emergency + fee.
Complete the BS Degree (142 credits) with a CGPA > 8.0. You can then register for the PG Diploma level (20 credits).
No. You must first complete the PG Diploma level. Then you can register for the MTech level (20 credit Project). The MTech degree is awarded upon completion of the project.
Flexible timeline, up to 5 years. It is designed for working professionals.

questions.q: Do I need a powerful laptop?
questions.a: Not really. A basic laptop with 4GB+ RAM is enough. However, a working webcam and microphone are mandatory for proctored exams and some sessions.
Strictly NO. Using ChatGPT/Gemini for graded assignments or OPPEs is considered Malpractice. The program uses advanced detection. Penalties include grade reduction or expulsion.
Google Chrome is the recommended browser for the exam portal and assignment submission.

Mostly no, but be aware of:
1. Facilitation Fee: Extra cost if writing exams outside India.
2. Exam Fee: Small fee for re-attempting only the exam (I_OP grade).
3. Paradox Fee: Tickets for the on-campus fest are paid.

questions.q: How much is the Deferral Fee?
questions.a: If you want to take a break for a term, you don't 'pay' a fee, you just don't register. However, keep in mind the maximum duration (years) allowed to complete the degree.
You need valid EWS/OBC-NCL certificates updated annually. Income verification is strict.
